channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Joe Biden's prostate cancer diagnosis. And, Kentucky residents react to deadly storm
item.description: Former President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with prostate cancer as renewed interest focuses on his decline while in office. And, over two dozen people died over the weekend due to powerful storms.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with prostate cancer as renewed interest focuses on his decline while in office. And, over two dozen people died over the weekend due to powerful storms.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump threatened school funding in Maine. Here's how that money is used
item.description: Schools in Maine are in the middle of a political and legal battle between the Trump administration and Gov. Janet Mills. Key programs for the most vulnerable students are at stake.
item.content:encoded:
Schools in Maine are in the middle of a political and legal battle between the Trump administration and Gov. Janet Mills. Key programs for the most vulnerable students are at stake.

(Image credit: Greta Rybus for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: Where does your weather forecast come from?
item.description: Whether you get your forecast from an app on your phone, a website or a meteorologist on TV, most of the underlying information comes from the federal government.
item.content:encoded:
Whether you get your forecast from an app on your phone, a website or a meteorologist on TV, most of the underlying information comes from the federal government.

(Image credit: Marcio Jose Sanchez)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher

item.title: How President Trump is sparking a crypto revolution in America
item.description: Crypto exchange giant Coinbase is set to join the S&P 500 on Monday. It's the latest stunning development as Trump completely revamps the approach to crypto in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
Crypto exchange giant Coinbase is set to join the S&P 500 on Monday. It's the latest stunning development as Trump completely revamps the approach to crypto in the U.S.

(Image credit: Jon Cherry)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: A pickled pepper maker knows exactly how hard it is to switch to natural food dyes
item.description: The MAHA movement loves the idea of getting rid of synthetic dyes in foods. But manufacturers face challenges that could drive prices higher.
item.content:encoded:
The MAHA movement loves the idea of getting rid of synthetic dyes in foods. But manufacturers face challenges that could drive prices higher.

(Image credit: BWFolsom/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Indians still pray at 'visa temples' after the U.S. deported migrants in chains
item.description: Hindu temples offer prayers for a path to the U.S. But some in India were stunned by the way the U.S. deported Indians despite Prime Minister Narendra Modi's friendship with President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Hindu temples offer prayers for a path to the U.S. But some in India were stunned by the way the U.S. deported Indians despite Prime Minister Narendra Modi's friendship with President Trump.

(Image credit: Diaa Hadid)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Horse racing industry braces for crackdown on illegal immigration
item.description: Horse racing depends on thousands of workers without legal status, and industry leaders fear that Trump's soft touch toward the industry in his first term will not persist in his second.
item.content:encoded:
Horse racing depends on thousands of workers without legal status, and industry leaders fear that Trump's soft touch toward the industry in his first term will not persist in his second.

(Image credit: Lydia Schweickart for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Verizon ends DEI policies to get FCC's blessing for its $20 billion Frontier deal
item.description: It's the latest big company to back away from its diversity pledges to keep the U.S. government happy.
item.content:encoded:
It's the latest big company to back away from its diversity pledges to keep the U.S. government happy.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Button-sized eggs and teapot cities: A peek into the big, wide world of miniatures
item.description: The pandemic helped supercharge a niche craft into a fine arts movement. Now the scene is more detailed and thoughtful than ever before.
item.content:encoded:
The pandemic helped supercharge a niche craft into a fine arts movement. Now the scene is more detailed and thoughtful than ever before.

(Image credit: Marina Totino)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: Trump DOJ changes to civil rights division spark mass exodus of attorneys
item.description: Current and former officials say the current effort amounts to the dismantling of the civil rights division and its traditional mission.
item.content:encoded:
Current and former officials say the current effort amounts to the dismantling of the civil rights division and its traditional mission.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas
